meanings.sent1: The farmer used dung to fertilize his crops.
meanings.sent2: The field was covered in cow dung.
meanings.sent3: The dung in the barn made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The dung scattered across the path was a reminder of the grazing cows.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh dung filled the air on the farm.

meanings.definition: To fertilize or dress with dung.
meanings.sent1: The gardener dunged the soil before planting the seeds.
meanings.sent2: Farmers dung their fields to improve crop growth.
meanings.sent3: The idea of dunging the garden with animal waste seemed strange at first.
meanings.sent4: She dunged the flower beds with care, ensuring each plant received enough nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The practice of dunging fields has been used for centuries to enhance soil fertility.

meanings.sent1: The dog dunged in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: Wild animals dung in specific areas to mark their territory.
meanings.sent3: The toddler dunged in the diaper just after breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The cat dunged discreetly in the litter box.
meanings.sent5: Birds dung from high above, creating unique patterns on the ground.
